channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: Tesla up another 3% in premarket trading after better-than-expected deliveries report
item.description: Tesla shares saw more gains in premarket trading Wednesday, after jumping 10% in the previous session.

item.title: The 'death knell' sounded for the Conservative Party long before the UK election, polling guru says
item.description: "This is not an election about the ideological position of the parties, this is an election about competence," said the U.K.'s polling expert, John Curtice.

item.title: History suggests bitcoin will likely hit a new all-time high this year, report says
item.description: Bitcoin has not reached the top of its current cycle and is likely to go past its all-time high this year, according to a research report by CCData.

item.title: After the icy Brexit years, the UK's relationship with the EU might thaw following the election
item.description: The Labour Party says it wants to "reset" relations with the EU but doesn't want to scare swing voters away from the party.

item.title: Six NYC hotels are providing free helicopter airport transfers into the city — with one small catch
item.description: Free transfers are available from John F. Kennedy International Airport and Newark Liberty International Airport for guests staying in select suites this summer.

item.title: Markets will be 'upset' if new French government does not commit to fiscal rules, European Central Bank's vice-president says
item.description: "What we have seen so far is that the evolution of [French] markets has been quite orderly," the vice president of the European Central Bank told CNBC.

item.title: 'It's not just Taylor Swift': ECB's Lagarde says Eras Tour is not alone in keeping euro zone inflation high
item.description: European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde said that Taylor Swift's Eras Tour is not alone in keeping inflation high across the euro zone.

item.title: Greece becomes first EU country to introduce a six-day working week
item.description: Greece has introduced a six-day working week for some businesses, seeking to boost productivity and employment in the southern European country.

item.title: The U.S. needs more of this critical metal — and China owns 80% of its supply chain
item.description: China dominates the supply chain for many of the world's critical minerals, but so far it's held off on sweeping restrictions on at least one: tungsten.

item.title: South Korean president announces tax breaks for companies that raise shareholder returns
item.description: These tax benefits will be given to companies that "actively expand dividends and push for [a] low-rate separate taxation on shareholders' dividend income tax."

item.title: China's young people are 'revenge saving' even as Gen Zers around the world are piling up debt
item.description: Rather than splurging on impulsive purchases, China's young are saving ferociously as the world's second-largest economy remains in the doldrums.

item.title: Philippines overtakes China and Indonesia to be most dependent on coal-generated power
item.description: The Philippines' dependency on coal-fired power overtook China, Indonesia and Poland in 2023, according to Ember.

item.title: Enough is enough: Japanese airlines clamp down on abusive travelers
item.description: Amid rising uncivility, Japan Airlines and All Nippon Airways outline the behaviors that constitute "customer harassment" of their staff members.

item.title: China's BYD is set to take Tesla's crown as the world's No. 1 producer of battery electric vehicles
item.description: Counterpoint Research on Tuesday said China "remains a dominant force in the BEV market" with BYD leading the way.

item.title: What are the best galleries in London? Artists choose their favorites
item.description: CNBC asked a mix of artists to name their favorite public and commercial galleries to visit in London — large or small.

item.title: Powell says Fed has made 'quite a bit of progress' on inflation but needs more confidence before cutting
item.description: "We've made quite a bit of progress and in bringing inflation back down to our target," Powell said at a central banking forum in Sintra, Portugal.

item.title: France's Macron made key mistakes and demonized the left, says bestselling economist Thomas Piketty
item.description: Thomas Piketty, bestselling French economist, pointed to what he described as one of Macron's biggest mistakes: neglecting and demonizing France's left wing.

item.title: Can't understand your teenager's behavior? Psychologists have tips to offer
item.description: Teenagers are often perceived as having little control over their emotions, and while parents may see this as unnecessary angst, it could be due to anxiety.

item.title: Skydance and National Amusements near Paramount deal as special committee reviews terms
item.description: National Amusements agreed to a preliminary deal to hand over control of Paramount to David Ellison's Skydance Media, the latest in a messy sales process.

item.title: How thousands of Americans got caught in fintech’s false promise and lost access to bank accounts
item.description: The Synapse collapse has revealed fintech's promise of safety as a mirage. More than 100,000 Americans with $265 million in deposits were locked from accounts.

item.title: First House Democrat urges Biden to withdraw from presidential race
item.description: Rep. Lloyd Doggett is the first sitting House Democrat to formally call on President Joe Biden to drop his reelection bid against former President Donald Trump.

item.title: Tesla shares soar 10% on better-than-expected Q2 deliveries report
item.description: Tesla's delivery numbers for the second quarter beat Wall Street estimates.

item.title: Peloton staved off the cash crunch that threatened its business. Where does it go now?
item.description: Peloton's looming debt pile raised concerns that the company could be pushed into bankruptcy. Now that Peloton has refinanced, it still has to fix its strategy.

item.title: FDA approves Eli Lilly Alzheimer’s drug, expanding treatment options in the U.S.
item.description: It's a long-awaited win for Eli Lilly after donanemab faced several delays in its path to the market, including an initial rejection from the FDA last year.

item.title: Trump sentencing date in hush money case postponed more than two months to Sept. 18
item.description: Trump's lawyers sought to challenge the hush money verdict after the Supreme Court ruled that ex-presidents have “presumptive immunity” for their official acts.

item.title: What a new Labour government will mean for the UK's foreign policy
item.description: The incoming U.K. government will confront a complex international landscape once Britons head to the polls on July 4.

item.title: GM reports best U.S. quarterly sales since 2020
item.description: Electric vehicle deliveries increased 40% compared to a year earlier to 21,930 units. Still, EVs made up only 3.2% of GM's total second-quarter sales.

item.title: Media mogul Barry Diller weighs a bid to gain control of Paramount
item.description: Barry Diller's IAC is weighing an offer for Shari Redstone's National Amusements Inc., which would give the media mogul control of Paramount.

item.title: Hungary’s Prime Minister Orban — a key Putin ally — makes first wartime visit to Ukraine
item.description: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban is widely viewed as Russia's closest ally within the European Union and is a vocal critic of NATO's support for Kyiv.

item.title: Iran faces runoff election between reformist and ultra-conservative presidential candidates amid record low turnout
item.description: Amid record-low voter turnout of around 40% in the election's first round Friday, two dramatically different candidates came out on top.
